meta_description: Waterworks Visual Arts Center in Salisbury, North Carolina is a non-collecting contemporary art museum. Waterworks engages the community through visual art exhibitions, outreach programs, events and classes for adults and children.
hours_text:
## Look for the ART banners

123 East Liberty Street; 1 block East of Main Street

## Plan Your Visit

### Free Admission * Free On-Street Parking

Located**** in the East Square Cultural Arts District of historic downtown Salisbury. 

#### **123 E. Liberty St.**

We are 2 blocks from the Amtrak Station, and within walking distance of many shops, historical sites, the public library, and eating establishments in our downtown and surrounding areas.

Directions to Waterworks

From I-85: Take Interstate 85 to Exit 76. If coming from the south (Charlotte area) turn left at the bottom of the exit ramp onto Innes Street (Hwy. 52). If coming from the north (Greensboro area) turn right at the bottom of the exit ramp onto Innes Street (Hwy. 52). Make a right on Main Street (downtown Salisbury), make a right on Liberty Street. 

Parking

**Free on-street parking** is available on East Liberty, North Lee, and East Council streets, and in the "Depot Lot" at the corner of East Council and Depot streets. All free parking is within two blocks of Waterworks. Handicap parking spaces are available at the entrance to Waterworks.

During non-business hours, free parking is available in the F&M Bank lot which adjoins Waterworks. To access the F&M Bank lot please use the Liberty Street entrance and pull slowly up to the automatic gate. Gate arm will lift as you approach.

Waterworks Visual Arts Center, as seen when coming from N. Main Street, across F&M Bank Parking lot

#### **Look for the ART Ba...
admission_text:
## Become a Waterworks Member

Your investment in Salisbury and Rowan County's premier visual arts organization enables Waterworks to meet its mission of providing diverse opportunities in the visual arts for all people through EXHIBITIONS, EDUCATION, and OUTREACH programs.

#### General 

Student (18 + ID) - $35

Individual - $100

Family (Household) - $150

Patron - $250 (includes SERM membership)

Choose a General Membership 

#### Director’s Circle

Collector - $500

Artist - $1,000

Printer - $1,500

Sculptor - $2,500

Painter - $5,000

Master - $10,000

$500+ may be paid in 2-4 equal installments over the membership year.

All Director’s Circle levels include both SERM, ROAM, and NARM memberships.

Join the Waterworks' Director's Circle 

#### Visionary

 _Multi-year pledges allow us to confidently plan into the future._

Bronze - $1,500/year for 3 years

Silver - $2,500/year for 3 years

Gold - $5,000/year for 3 years

Platinum - $10,000/year for 3 years

Become an ART Visionary 

[ ](https://www.semcdirect.net/reciprocal)

Family-level ($150) and above members includes reciprocal benefits in the Southeastern Reciprocal Membership program. Benefits include **free admission to any of the over 190 participating museums throughout the Southeast, plus other member benefits such as discounts in museum shops, and/or discounts on concert/lecture tickets.**

Visit <https://www.semcdirect.net/reciprocal> to view a complete listing of participating museums.

** _**The following holidays could affect these hours:_**

_New Year’s Day, President’s Day, Easter, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas._

### **_SPECIAL NOTICE:_**

_Waterworks Galleries will be closed to the public_** _March 2-March 20, 2026_** _for facility maintenance._

_Classes and outreach programs will not be effected and will proceed as scheduled._
